sentence: The same exact patterns that made me a great businessperson were the same patterns that made me a great athlete.
revision: The same ingrained patterns that contributed to my success in business also played a role in my achievements as an athlete.
justification:
Changes made:
1. Replacing "exact" with "ingrained" for a stronger and more descriptive word.
2. Replacing "made me" with "contributed to my success" for variety and clarity.
3. Reordering the sentence for better flow.

sentence: The same exact patterns that made me a great businessperson were the same patterns that made me a great athlete.
revision: The strengths and patterns that led to my success in business also translated seamlessly into my athletic endeavors.

Changes made:
1. Replaced "same exact" with "same" to eliminate redundancy.
2. Added "strengths and" to provide more specificity and clarity.
3. Changed "made me" to "led to my success in" for a more professional tone.
4. Replaced "were" with "also translated seamlessly into" for a smoother transition between the two attributes mentioned.

sentence: My philosophy as a mortgage loan originator and a businessperson is very straightforward: I believe that if you help people, and put yourself in their shoes, then your business will take care of itself.

sentence: After seeing many more workmates take their own lives than the years that I have been a firefighter, I realized that the stress we face is a cumulative and permanent reality of our profession.
revision: After witnessing several of my colleagues take their own lives during my time as a firefighter, I came to the realization that the stress we endure is an ongoing and unshakeable aspect of our profession.
justification:
Changes made:
1. Reworded the sentence to improve clarity and flow.
2. Replaced "many more workmates" with "several of my colleagues" for a more precise description.
3. Changed "than the years that I have been a firefighter" to "during my time as a firefighter" for a more concise phrase.

sentence: After seeing many more workmates take their own lives than the years that I have been a firefighter, I realized that the stress we face is a cumulative and permanent reality of our profession.
revision: After witnessing too many of my workmates tragically take their own lives during my time as a firefighter, I came to the sobering realization that the stress we endure is a persistent and cumulative aspect of our profession.
justification:
Changes made:
1. Reworded the sentence for clarity and flow.
2. Used "witnessing" instead of "seeing" to convey a deeper emotional impact.
3. Added the word "tragically" for emphasis on the seriousness of the situation.
4. Replaced "years" with "time" to avoid repetition of the word "years".
5. Changed "permanent reality" to "persistent aspect" for better phrasing.

sentence: After seeing many more workmates take their own lives than the years that I have been a firefighter, I realized that the stress we face is a cumulative and permanent reality of our profession.
revision: After witnessing several of my colleagues succumb to the pressures of our profession through suicide, I came to the sobering realization that the stress we endure is a lasting and cumulative component of our work as firefighters.
justification:
Changes made:
1. Increased the use of descriptive language to enhance the impact of the sentence.
2. Improved the flow of the sentence by restructuring it for clarity. 
3. Replaced the word "workmates" with "colleagues" for a more professional tone. 
4. Substituted "take their own lives" with "succumb to the pressures of our profession through suicide" to provide a more sensitive and descriptive expression.

4. "in order to support individuals" - This phrase clarifies the goal of guiding and assisting individuals in challenging situations.
5. "during their most challenging moments" - This phrase conveys the idea that firefighters are there to help individuals during times of difficulty and stress.
